com.wizarpos.devices.pinpad
Interface PINPadControl

All Superinterfaces:
DeviceControl
public interface PINPadControl
extends DeviceControl

PINPad device is an exclusive device. It can't be opened again if it's already opened.

Since:
Author:
hans

Method Detail

open

void open(int logicalID)
          throws DeviceException
Opens the control of the PINPad.

Parameters:
logicalID - logical ID of the device to open.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
  • if the logicalID is invalid.

showText

void showText(int nLineIndex,
              java.lang.String message)
              throws DeviceException
Display message in the LCD.

Parameters:
nLineIndex -
message -
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException, or these reasons:
  • if the message is too long.

selectKey

void selectKey(int nKeyType,
               int nMasterKeyID,
               int nUserKeyID,
               int nAlgorithm)
               throws DeviceException
Select the key and algorithm for the next encryption operation.

Parameters:
nKeyType - : the constants of KEY_TYPE_DUKPT, KEY_TYPE_TDUKPT, KEY_TYPE_MK_SK, KEY_TYPE_PUBLIC, KEY_TYPE_FIX
nMasterKeyID - : master key ID , [0x00, ..., 0x09], make sense only when nKeyType is KEY_TYPE_MK_SK
nUserKeyType - : user key ID, the constants of KEY_ID_PIN, KEY_ID_MAC
nAlgorithm - the constants of ALG_DES or ALG_3DES
Throws:
DeviceException

updateUserKey

void updateUserKey(int nMasterKeyID,
                   int nUserKeyID,
                   byte[] bufCipherNewUserKey)
                   throws DeviceException
Update the user key(session key). The buffer is the cipher user key which encrypted by master key.

Parameters:
nMasterKeyID -
nUserKeyID -
bufCipherNewUserKey -
Throws:
DeviceException

EncryptData

byte[] EncryptData(byte[] bufPlain)
                   throws DeviceException
encrypt the data using user key defined in selectKey (common encrypt method, for MAC, better to invoke calculateMac()).

Parameters:
arryPlainText - : plain text buffer return the encrypted data
Throws:
DeviceException

waitForPinBlock

PINPadOperationResult waitForPinBlock(int operationID,
                                      java.lang.String PAN,
                                      boolean voicePrompt,
                                      int timeout)
                                      throws DeviceException
Let the user input the PIN and calculate the encrypted pin block.

Parameters:
operationID - the flag of the get PIN block action. One of the constants OPERATION_ID_GET_PIN or OPERATION_ID_CHANGE_PIN
PAN - the ASCII string of the card number.
timeout - the maximum pending time of the method, in milliseconds. Note that the timeout will begin when the request begins to be processed. The timeout parameter is then only indicative. There are two special cases for timeout, as follows:
  • If timeout == FOREVER, the method will wait until something is available on the associated service's input.
  • If timeout == IMMEDIATE, the method will immediately read the input
voicePrompt - play the audio to notice user.
Returns:
the buffer of the encrypted PIN block.
Throws:
DeviceException

listenForPinBlock

void listenForPinBlock(int operationID,
                       java.lang.String PAN,
                       boolean voicePrompt,
                       OperationListener listener)
                       throws DeviceException
Throws:
DeviceException

calculateMac

byte[] calculateMac(int nMACFlag,
                    byte[] arryData)
                    throws DeviceException
Calculate the MAC using current user key.

Parameters:
nMACFlag - the constants of MAC_METHOD_X99, MAC_METHOD_ECB
arryData - the plain data return the data buffer of the MAC
Throws:
DeviceException

setPINLength

void setPINLength(int minLen,
                  int maxLen)
Set the length limitation of the PIN inputting.

Parameters:
minLen - the minimal length of the PIN when inputting.
maxLen - the maximal length of the PIN when inputting.
